attributes.action: For rape and sexual assault to be on the curriculum
attributes.additional_details: So this generation can understand the effects of rape and sexual assault and so this will decrease the assault rates in the UK.
attributes.background: So this generation can understand the effects of rape and sexual assault and so this will decrease the assault rates in the UK.

rejection.details:
As part of the new Relationships Education curriculum, which has replaced PSHE, schools are already required to teach secondary school students about sexual consent, sexual exploitation, abuse, grooming, coercion, harassment, rape, domestic abuse, forced marriage, honour-based violence and FGM.

You can read the full Relationships Education curriculum here: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1090195/Relationships_Education_RSE_and_Health_Education.pdf
